name: suite-sparse

conflicts.name: ^intel-oneapi-tbb@2021:
conflicts.description: suite-sparse needs task_scheduler_init.h dropped in recent tbb libs

conflicts.name: %gcc@:4.8
conflicts.description: gcc version must be at least 4.9 for suite-sparse@5.2.0:

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: pic
variants.description: Build position independent code (required to link with shared libraries)

variants.name: graphblas
variants.description: Build with GraphBLAS (takes a long time to compile)

description: SuiteSparse is a suite of sparse matrix algorithms

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description:
Intel Math Kernel Library. This package has been replaced by intel-
oneapi-mkl. LICENSE INFORMATION: By downloading and using this software,
you agree to the terms and conditions of the software license agreements
at https://intel.ly/393CijO.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: mpfr
dependencies.description:
The MPFR library is a C library for multiple-precision floating-point
computations with correct rounding.

dependencies.name: gmp
dependencies.description:
GMP is a free library for arbitrary precision arithmetic, operating on
signed integers, rational numbers, and floating-point numbers.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: metis
dependencies.description:
METIS is a set of serial programs for partitioning graphs, partitioning
finite element meshes, and producing fill reducing orderings for sparse
matrices. The algorithms implemented in METIS are based on the
multilevel recursive-bisection, multilevel k-way, and multi-constraint
partitioning schemes.

dependencies.name: tbb
dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.

dependencies.name: intel-tbb
dependencies.description:
Widely used C++ template library for task parallelism. Intel Threading
Building Blocks (Intel TBB) lets you easily write parallel C++ programs
that take full advantage of multicore performance, that are portable and
composable, and that have future-proof scalability.

dependent_to.name: octave
dependent_to.description:
GNU Octave is a high-level language, primarily intended for numerical
computations. It provides a convenient command line interface for
solving linear and nonlinear problems numerically, and for performing
other numerical experiments using a language that is mostly compatible
with Matlab. It may also be used as a batch-oriented language.

dependent_to.name: sundials
dependent_to.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)

dependent_to.name: dealii
dependent_to.description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.

dependent_to.name: py-pynucleus
dependent_to.description:
PyNucleus is a finite element code that specifically targets nonlocal
operators.

dependent_to.name: petsc
dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.

dependent_to.name: mfem
dependent_to.description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.

dependent_to.name: augustus
dependent_to.description:
AUGUSTUS is a program that predicts genes in eukaryotic genomic
sequences

dependent_to.name: fenics
dependent_to.description:
FEniCS is organized as a collection of interoperable components that
together form the FEniCS Project. These components include the problem-
solving environment DOLFIN, the form compiler FFC, the finite element
tabulator FIAT, the just-in-time compiler Instant / Dijitso, the code
generation interface UFC, the form language UFL and a range of
additional components.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-sparse
dependent_to.description:
Sparse matrix tools extending scipy.sparse, but with incompatible
licenses

dependent_to.name: py-cvxopt
dependent_to.description:
CVXOPT is a free software package for convex optimization based on the
Python programming language.

dependent_to.name: julia
dependent_to.description: The Julia Language: A fresh approach to technical computing

dependent_to.name: goma
dependent_to.description:
A Full-Newton Finite Element Program for Free and Moving Boundary
Problems with Coupled Fluid/Solid Momentum, Energy, Mass, and Chemical
Species Transport

dependent_to.name: g2o
dependent_to.description:
g2o is an open-source C++ framework for optimizing graph-based nonlinear
error functions. g2o has been designed to be easily extensible to a wide
range of problems and a new problem typically can be specified in a few
lines of code. The current implementation provides solutions to several
variants of SLAM and BA.

dependent_to.name: trilinos
dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependent_to.name: 3dtk
dependent_to.description:
The 3D Toolkit provides algorithms and methods to process 3D point
clouds. It includes automatic high-accurate registration (6D
simultaneous localization and mapping, 6D SLAM) and other tools, e.g., a
fast 3D viewer, plane extraction software, etc. Several file formats for
the point clouds are natively supported, new formats can be implemented
easily.

dependent_to.name: hiop
dependent_to.description:
HiOp is an optimization solver for solving certain mathematical
optimization problems expressed as nonlinear programming problems. HiOp
is a lightweight HPC solver that leverages application"s existing data
parallelism to parallelize the optimization iterations by using
specialized linear algebra kernels.

dependent_to.name: ceed
dependent_to.description:
Ceed is a collection of benchmarks, miniapps, software libraries and
APIs for efficient high-order finite element and spectral element
discretizations for exascale applications developed in the Department of
Energy (DOE) and partially supported by the Exascale Computing Project
(ECP). This is a Spack bundle package that installs the CEED software
components.
